Strong Q4 FY25 Performance (as of March 31, 2025):

Cholamandalam Investment and Finance Company Ltd announced strong Q4 and full-year results.

Total disbursements for FY25 crossed ₹1 lakh crore, a 14% year-on-year growth.

Assets Under Management (AUM) grew by 30% to reach ₹1,99,876 crore.

The company maintained a healthy Capital Adequacy Ratio (CAR) of 19.75%.

A final dividend of ₹0.70 per share was recommended by the board.

RBI's Dividend Boost to Government Finances (May 2025):

Around this period, the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) announced a significant dividend of ₹2.69 lakh crore to the government.

This was expected to help the government meet its fiscal deficit target.

Broader Market Context (May 1, 2025):

OnMay 1, 2025, the Nifty 50 index showed a positive trend, closing above the 25,000 mark and its 100-day moving average (DMA).

However, the Bank Nifty underperformed the Nifty 50 on the same day.
